attributes.action: Introduce compulsory First Aid Training to the schools national curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
A leading charity states 'up to 150,000 people a year could be given a chance to live if more people knew first aid' 

Additionally, in 2014, there were 22,807 seriously injured casualties in reported road traffic accidents.

This facts and figures could be drastically reduced in the future by targeting the young people of today.
attributes.background: I feel that the government needs to establish compulsory First Aid Training to youth in the educational system this can be easily be incorporated into the national curriculum.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept duplicate petitions. We think this petition is similar to yours:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/105790

You might like to sign this petition instead. It is more likely to get more signatures that way.
